Package seng201.islandtradergame.ui.gui

Class MainMenu

java.lang.Object
seng201.islandtradergame.ui.gui.MainMenu
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.util.EventListener
public class MainMenu
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener
This class implements the mainMenu GUI, this GUI is used to set up some of the game paramiters such as ship name, how many day the game will run for and what ship the player wants to use.
Author:
Kei Carden

    private void barStats​(int size)
    Sets the value on the progress bars according to the current ship size
    private void checkCanContinue()
    Enables the accept button and removes the error labels if the user has selected a ship and has entered a valid name (Only contains letters and having more than 3 characters).

    Initialise the contents of the frame.

    void mouseExited​(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
    Checks if a user has stopped hovering over one of the radio buttons that implements mouseEvent If a radio button has been selected then the ship stats bars are not updated Otherwise the ship stats JPanle will hide when the user stops hovering over a radio button.

  • Constructor Details

    • MainMenu

      public MainMenu​(Island[] islands)
      Creates the main menu window with the five islands. Initialise is called setting up the GUI
      Parameters:
      islands - The array of islands that was set up in main

  • Method Details

    • initialise

      private void initialise()
      Initialise the contents of the frame.

    • setupShipStatsPane

      private void setupShipStatsPane()
      Creates the JPane that contains the ship stats components.

    • barStats

      private void barStats​(int size)
      Sets the value on the progress bars according to the current ship size
      Parameters:
      size - The size of ship selected can be from 1 to 4

    • shipSize

      private void shipSize​(javax.swing.JRadioButton rBTN)
      Determines the ship size from the radio button selected.
      Parameters:
      rBTN - The radio button that has been clicked

    • mouseClicked

      public void mouseClicked​(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      Determines when a user has clicked one of the radio buttons that implements mouseEvent
      Specified by:
      mouseClicked in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
      Parameters:
      e - The component that has been clicked

    • mouseEntered

      public void mouseEntered​(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      Checks if a user has hovered over one of the radio buttons that implements mouseEvent. If a radio button has been selected then the ship stats bars are not updated Otherwise the ship stats bars will be updated with the current ship size the user is hovering over
      Specified by:
      mouseEntered in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
      Parameters:
      e - The component that has been hovered over

    • mouseExited

      public void mouseExited​(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      Checks if a user has stopped hovering over one of the radio buttons that implements mouseEvent If a radio button has been selected then the ship stats bars are not updated Otherwise the ship stats JPanle will hide when the user stops hovering over a radio button.
      Specified by:
      mouseExited in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
      Parameters:
      e - The component that has been hovered over

    • checkCanContinue

      private void checkCanContinue()
      Enables the accept button and removes the error labels if the user has selected a ship and has entered a valid name (Only contains letters and having more than 3 characters). Otherwise disables the accept button.

    • quit

      void quit()
